data.title: strange sorting order of QuickPick help
data.body:
on testing #2791:

The sorting order of QP items is strange. It is not alphabetically but it isn't by importance either.

![2016-02-23 23-33-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13269055/229ae6dc-da86-11e5-99a8-cf28c891c73b.png)

I suggest to move the extensions to the bottom because they already have 4 items that clutter the list but are only used sporadically.

data.title: Top of debug panel should be responsive
data.body:
When the debug panel gets narrow the title and button disappear, becoming unusable with the mouse.

Regular view:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13268966/39a06614-da3a-11e5-8b56-b0791ea72dc9.png)

Currently narrow view:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13268959/2b624f9a-da3a-11e5-9f2a-aeb5ba782a34.png)

It should become something like this when the panel is sufficiently narrow so the button/title doesn't go missing.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13269042/a3aa8dbe-da3a-11e5-85d4-d61d63271f10.png)

data.title: Make the keyboard focus outline configurable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
#3246

I have a lot of difficulty on Dark+ theme finding some of the keyboard focuses. Can a fatter border be used to represent focus so it's more clear?

data.title: Keyboard accessibility: Strange behavior when focusing item after text editor
data.body:
#3246

When tab focus mode is on, doing the following:
- Select text editor
- Press <kbd>tab</kbd>
- At this point I have no idea what is focused as I can't see anything on the UI with a border.
  - Pressing <kbd>enter</kbd> will add a new line where the cursor was, pressing <kbd>enter</kbd> again will not add another line
  - Pressing <kbd>enter</kbd> will add a new line, pressing <kbd>backspace</kbd> and <kbd>enter</kbd> will add another new line

data.title: [extension developping] Setting "vscode": "^0.10.7" fails on Travis
data.body:
Hi,

when I set `"vscode": "0.10.x"` in `engine` part of a `package.json`, everything fails.

Mac OS says:

node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install
Detected VS Code engine version: ^0.10.7
Error installing vscode.d.ts: TypeError: Object #<Object> has no method 'map'
npm ERR! Darwin 13.4.0
npm ERR! argv "node" "/usr/local/bin/npm" "install"
npm ERR! node v0.10.32
npm ERR! npm  v2.0.0
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! jsthis@0.0.1 postinstall: `node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the jsthis@0.0.1 postinstall script.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the jsthis package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/install
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls jsthis
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.
npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!5m     /Users/travis/build/obrejla/vscode-jsthis/npm-debug.log

Linux process the installation, but my code then fails on:

TypeError: alsoThisVars.slice is not a function
      at shouldComplete (src/ThisCompletionItemProvider.js:49:33)
      at Object.module.exports.provideCompletionItems (src/ThisCompletionItemProvider.js:139:13)
      at test/thiscompletionitemprovider.test.js:89:62
      at Object.p [as _notify](.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1440:1)
      at Object.__dirname.undefined.L.enter (.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1127:1)
      at [object Object].__dirname.undefined.t.Class.define._run (.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1343:1)
      at [object Object].__dirname.undefined.t.Class.define._completed (.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/vs/base/common/winjs.base.raw.js:1311:1)
      at Object.p.handle (.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/file:/vso/work/3/s/src/vs/platform/plugins/common/ipcRemoteCom.ts:86:11)
      at process.<anonymous> (.vscode-test/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/vs/workbench/node/file:/vso/work/3/s/src/vs/workbench/node/pluginHostProcess.ts:42:15)

Where `alsoThisVars` is an array returned by `vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('jsthis.thisVarNames')`.

Everything passes locally (Mac) and when I set engine to `0.10.x`, then it passes also on [Travis](https://travis-ci.org/obrejla/vscode-jsthis).

Thanks`

data.title: Show Accessibility Help Alt+F1 hotkey is an invalid on Ubuntu
data.body:
#3246

<kbd>alt</kbd>+<kbd>F1</kbd> focuses the launcher and allows keyboard navigation on Ubuntu. Show Accessibility Help can be accessed via command palette in a text view though.

@msftclas

data.title: CompletionList on Travis - TypeError: vscode.CompletionList is not a function
data.body:
Hi, 

when I implement a custom `CompletionItemProvider` which returns `new vscode.CompletionList([], false);` in its `provideCompletionItems` method, then tests locally pass, but after `git push` it fails on Travis CI with message: `TypeError: vscode.CompletionList is not a function`. vscode is properly required.

Thanks!

data.title: "Visual Basic" language should be labelled "Visual Basic .NET"
data.body: Since it's derived from [this](https://github.com/textmate/asp.vb.net.tmbundle) is should be labelled "Visual Basic .NET". Visual Basic ended at v6.0.

Hi,

I can't switch the opened Folder in "Extension Development Host" to the same Folder I already have opened in my Main VSC.

Thanks.

data.title: PowerShell: DSC's Node keyword isn't highlighted
data.body: In PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC), the `node` keyword is used to create "node blocks" inside a DSC `configuration` document. Unfortunately, this keyword isn't highlighted properly. Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Provide jsdoc highlighting
data.body:
Supporting jsdoc highlighting would make them easier to read, this comment documentation style is pretty widespread.

``` js
/**
 * Sorts an array.
 * @param {Array} arr The array to sort.
 * @returns An array.
 */
function sort(array) {
  ...
}
```

`@param`, `@returns` at the least would be easy to highlight (Atom supports this). `{Array}` and `arr` could potentially also be highlighted.

Related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/514

data.title: Tab moves focus message not consistently displayed
data.body:
#3246

This message [red in status bar] was not always displayed e.g. when I closed all editor windows it would go away - the tab would still shift focus but this was not what I expected.

data.title: Allow multiple of the left panels to be displayed at once

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I tend to avoid the search and git panes simply due to the fact that it hides my folder explorer and working files. This is loosely related to [no tabs](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/224) as my current working files disappear when I go to these panels.

It would be very useful in particular to see my git working tree status alongside working files and folder explorer.

data.title: how to make debug console vertical
data.body:
It's changed to horizontal and now consumes 40% of my editor space automatically every time I run my program. Extremely annoying, and impossible to get rid of: closing it just reopens it the moment something logs to the console.

How can I get the previous "vertical" debugger? Or better yet, how can I pull the debug console out into its own window?

data.title: Provide GUI for extensions/themes
data.body: Installing extensions and themes would be easier if there was a GUI to do so. It's currently somewhat hidden in the command palette, especially for users not familiar with similar editors.

data.title: Provide GUI for settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Customizing Code would be far less intimidating to new users if there was a GUI for settings customization.

data.title: Ruller position is +1 from my expectation
data.body:
#3233

Multiple rulers work great and look great.  

However, when I configure a set of rulers e.g. [20,40,90,140] I expected the ruler to land on that column not the one after that.  This could be by design but I found it a little confusing as I wanted to know that once I reached the ruler I had hit column 20 vs 21.

![screen shot 2016-02-23 at 8 57 03 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/13259251/73afbcb2-da0b-11e5-87a1-164905a6139e.png)

data.title: [folding] should not fold whitespace after function
data.body:
Consider the Python script:

``` python
def a:
  pass



def b:
  pass
```

Currently all whitespace following the `pass` in `a` is collapsed with it:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13259252/7447658a-da0b-11e5-810b-bebd4639b294.png)

This will make it the code harder to read in some cases as there is no space between the functions are the author intended, making `a` look more like part of `b`.

data.title: [folding] Collapse ending brace to the same line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Consider a large JavaScript file

``` js
function a() {
  ...
}

function b() {
  ...
}

function c() {
  ...
}

and so on...
```

Collapsing all currently yields:

``` js
function a() { ...
}

function b() { ...
}

function c() { ...
}

and so on...
```

This would be more readable if the closing brace was on the same line:

``` js
function a() { ... }

function b() { ... }

function c() { ... }

and so on...
```

---

Here is how other prominent editors handle the above:

**Atom**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13259023/7d4c38d2-da0a-11e5-9407-f1c7de7c4a61.png)

**Brackets**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13259033/8d71e2f2-da0a-11e5-9934-378ecb450179.png)

**Sublime Text 3**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13259075/aeb3e97e-da0a-11e5-9b0a-7ff709146520.png)

---

**VS Code**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/13259189/29190a8c-da0b-11e5-97bd-3513fb837097.png)

data.title: Allow output channel to stay in scroll position
data.body:
I would be nice if the output window if you are not on the bottom of the scroll position to keep your current position when new output is added.

Sometimes you're trying to read through the output and something new gets pushed there and then the scroll goes instantly to the bottom
